location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.2100 of 1852 from Henry Edward Goldsmid, Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Covering letter enclosing extracts of paragraphs 45 and 46 of a despatch from the Honourable Court of Directors (f 126), dated 21 January 1852. Paragraph 45 states that the towns of the Guttur [Qatar] coast (Wukrah, Doah, Fowarait) have been required to pay compensation of 1000 (later 900) Crowns for acts of piracy committed by the pirate Soheil bin Aleish. Paragraph 46 states that the Chief of Bahrain has taken the responsibility for paying this compensation.
